alert.note: Alert for Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:22PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Oneida, northwestern Madison and central Onondaga Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Syracuse, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, De Witt, Sullivan, Oneida, Lenox, Pompey, North Syracuse, Solvay and Verona. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 33 and 37. New York Interstate 81 between 15 and 29 South. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central New York.

area.areaDesc: Madison; Northern Oneida; Onondaga; Southern Oneida
